title: Calories in Sesame Oil
meta_description: Discover calories in sesame oil per tablespoon, including full nutrition breakdown, fat content, and quick serving tweaks for your recipes.
assumptions: Pure sesame oil, 1 tablespoon serving (about 14 g), untoasted or toasted variety; no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, refinement (toasted vs. light), and exact volume; always check product labels for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One tablespoon of sesame oil provides 120 calories, primarily from healthy unsaturated fats.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with product packaging.

tweaks.label: Toasted sesame oil (slightly more flavorful, same fat profile)
Light/refined sesame oil (lower aroma, similar calories)

faqs.q: How many calories in one tablespoon of sesame oil?
Is sesame oil high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, 14 g total fat per tablespoon, with 2 g saturated and mostly unsaturated fats.

faqs.q: Does sesame oil have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, sugars, or proteinâ€”it's pure fat.

faqs.q: What's the difference in calories between toasted and untoasted sesame oil?
faqs.a: Negligible difference; both are around 120 kcal per tablespoon.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g of sesame oil?
faqs.a: Approximately 884 kcal per 100 g, since it's nearly 100% fat.
